alert.note: Alert for Flathead, Mission Valleys; Kootenai, Cabinet Region; Lower Clark Fork Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 5:56PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Lake and southeastern Sanders Counties through 645 PM MDT... At 555 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong thunderstorms 12 miles north of Dixon, or 17 miles southwest of Polson, moving west at 55 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rain, winds in excess of 30 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Old Agency, Dixon, Kerr, Hot Springs, Camas Prairie, Moiese, Round Butte, Perma, Camas, Lonepine and Charlo. This includes Highway 200 W between mile markers 87 and 109. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
